intro: Aldama radula, commonly known as the Mexican spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and Mexico. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Aldama radula is known for its ability to bloom throughout the growing season, making it a valuable addition to native gardens.
